intro: Trianosperma attenuatum, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit with fleshy, ribbed stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, helping to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Trianosperma attenuatum is adapted to survive in sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky outcrops.
